project.teaser: The objective of PoliRuralPlus is to foster a sustainable, balanced, equitable, place-based and inclusive development of rural and urban areas through improved connections, governance arrangements, and integrated territorial policies that prioritise experimentation and...
project.objective:
The objective of PoliRuralPlus is to foster a sustainable, balanced, equitable, place-based and inclusive development of rural and urban areas through improved connections, governance arrangements, and integrated territorial policies that prioritise experimentation and innovation in domains that favour bi-directional urban-rural synergies and the development of a well-being economy.
Key focus will be driven by Foresight, planning and implementation of integrated urban-rural strategies.
The PoliRuralPlus project aims to improve the quality of life for people living in urban and rural areas across the EU by promoting coordinated and collaborative development within the regions. The project will support 9 pilot projects (including 8 from the previous PoliRural project and 1 new project) that focus on developing rural-urban partnerships. The aim is to increase the resilience and interconnectedness of urban and rural areas.
In terms of financing, the project will demonstrate successful application of funding mechanisms to support these partnerships, including public-private partnerships, crowdfunding, and other innovative financing models. The goal is to find sustainable financing solutions that can support the long-term development of these partnerships.
PoliRuralPlus will validate an EU-wide regional-driven integrated territorial planning & implementation Action-Foresight Process & Tool Box, by extending the latter’s Innovation Hub through the European Digital Innovation Hubs using open-source System Dynamic Modelling & a GIS collaborative online service called Map Whiteboard, enhanced by up-to-date Artificial Intelligence and Deep Learning (AI/DL) applicable algorithms.
The project has an ambition to become an integral part of the New European Bauhaus due to its lighthouse success of gradual buildup of hands-on experience using up-to-date tools supporting decision-making process based on foresight principles.
project.title: Fostering Sustainable, Balanced, Equitable, Place-based and Inclusive Development of Rural-Urban Communities' Using Specific Spatial Enhanced Attractivenes Mapping ToolBox
project.keywords: Regional Action Plan, Foresight, eTools, Rural Urban Synergies, New European Bauhaus

result.title: Open Call Package
result.description: "Deliverable D6.1 ""Open Call Package"" encompasses a series of activities designed to engage third parties in the project. The package aims to define the scope and objectives of the calls for third parties in line with the project's specific needs and priorities. It involves the development of comprehensive call documentation, including guidelines for applicants, well-structured application forms, transparent evaluation criteria, and clear timelines."

result.title: RAP Methodology
result.description: "Deliverable D3.1 ""RAP Methodology"" aims to extend the PoliRuralPlus Methodological Framework from WP2 to support rural-urban interactions. It will develop a draft methodology integrating foresight activities and stakeholder engagement for co-creating Regional Action Plans (RAPs). The deliverable also suggests updating digital tools to better implement the new methodological framework efficiently."

result.title: Policy Brief No. 1
result.description: "The D7.3 ""Policy Brief No. 1"" will summarize all the policy-relevant outcomes from the first half of project duration, which will help to promote integrated rural-urban development. Let’s mention for example financial incentives and participatory planning processes, policies that promote transparency and accountability in decision-making processes, including the use of open data and participatory budgeting or policies that promote innovative financial mechanisms to support integrated urban-rural development, such as the use of public-private partnerships, green bonds, and crowdfunding."

result.title: Comprehensive handbook, guidelines and materials for communication and dissemination, first edition
result.description: Deliverable D7.1 focuses on co-creating and implementing a comprehensive strategy and action plan for communication, dissemination, and result exploitation. The deliverable includes defining key messages, identifying suitable communication tools, outreach channels, and timelines. The dissemination framework is structured around project partners, incorporating multi-actors' activities via workshops and place-based settings. It involves populating online platforms with impactful materials and organizing various onsite/digital activities to engage audiences, such as roundtables, workshops, conferences, and exhibitions.D7.1 is a first edition which will be updated towards the end of the project in D7.6 (M34).

result.title: Project Web Pages Update
result.description: The website will be based on the PoliRural Hub, a product of the PoliRural Project. It will not only serve as a presentation platform but also function as a tool for data management and presentation.

result.title: OpenStreetMap as the Data Source for Territorial Innovation Potential Assessment
Open Calls Detailed Strategy and Timeline
result.description: This deliverable involves formulating a strategy and timeline for the initiation of open calls, detailing criteria for selection and focus areas of research and development. Additionally, it will outline the dissemination channels and stakeholder engagement strategy to ensure the widespread reach and effectiveness of the calls.

result.title: Stakeholders identification
result.description: The stakeholders to be identified in Deliverable D2.1 of the PoliRuralPlus project include local communities, governments, farmers, SMEs, industry associations, research institutions, NGOs, civil society groups, infrastructure providers, digital technology companies, financial institutions, and tourism sector representatives. These stakeholders play crucial roles in driving and shaping rural-urban linkages and opportunities within the project area.

result.title: Prepared pilot by Stakeholder Multi-Actor Approach
result.description: "Deliverable D5.1 ""Prepared pilot by Stakeholder Multi-Actor Approach"" is part of T5.1. Collaboration with stakeholders identified in T3.2 is established to contribute to the preparation and development of Regional Action Plans (RAPs). Through the Multi-Actor Approach, communication with stakeholders helps identify gaps, challenges, and opportunities in the pilot regions."

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - PoliRuralPlus (Fostering Sustainable, Balanced, Equitable, Place-based and Inclusive Development of Rural-Urban Communities' Using Specific Spatial Enhanced Attractivenes Mapping ToolBox)
result.teaser: PoliRuralPlus addresses persistent disparities and weak urban–rural cooperation in Europe, building on the achievements of the H2020 PoliRural project. Its aim is to extend foresight-based planning methods to integrated rural–urban territories, supporting sustainable...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Rural-urban linkages and opportunities post COVID-19
result.description: "Deliverable D2.2 ""Rural-urban linkages and opportunities post COVID-19"" focuses on assessing the impact of COVID-19 on rural-urban linkages and opportunities within the project area. It involves collecting and analyzing data to understand the effects of the pandemic on key sectors and activities driving these linkages, as well as identifying both direct and indirect consequences on rural and urban regions. The deliverable also aims to identify the challenges and opportunities that have emerged as a result of the pandemic."

result.title: PoliRuralPlus platform design
result.description: "Deliverable D4.1 ""PoliRuralPlus Platform Design"" aims to identify and integrate AI/DL technologies with approved PoliRural technological solutions (PoliRural Hub, Rural Attractiveness, Policy Option Explorer). The design will be a basis for the D4.2, ""PoliRuralPlus platform Beta""."

category.title: geographic information systems
category.displayCode: /natural sciences/earth and related environmental sciences/physical geography/cartography/geographic information systems

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
